summary: This is an email from the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit in New York requesting a weekly update on victim services related to the Epstein case. It asks for the number of victims contacted, services offered and accepted, and whether services are being arranged.
keyFacts: The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking unit in New York was actively tracking victim services related to the Epstein case as of August 2019.
The email requests a weekly 'Epstein Significant Activity Report' (SAR) to monitor victim outreach and support.
The inquiry covers multiple locations including New York and Miami, indicating a multi-jurisdictional victim response effort.
The document shows an ongoing institutional effort to document and provide services to victims after Epstein's arrest.
